001package game;
002import java.util.StringTokenizer;
003
004/**
005 * This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. 
006 * "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
007 * 
008 * This parser reads user input and tries to interpret it as an "Adventure"
009 * command. Every time it is called it reads a line from the terminal and
010 * tries to interpret the line as a two word command. It returns the command
011 * as an object of class Command.
012 *
013 * The parser has a set of known command words. It checks user input against
014 * the known commands, and if the input is not one of the known commands, it
015 * returns a command object that is marked as an unknown command.
016 * 
017 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau + Christophe TARATIBU
018 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2013.09.15 + 09.01.2026
019 */
020public class Parser 
021{
022
023    /** Words used as commands */
024    private final CommandWords aCommandWords;  // (voir la classe CommandWords)
025    /**
026     * Constructeur par defaut qui cree les 2 objets prevus pour les attributs
027     */
028    public Parser() 
029    {
030        this.aCommandWords = new CommandWords();
031        // System.in designe le clavier, comme System.out designe l'ecran
032    } // Parser()
033
034    /**
035     *  Retrieve the command
036     * @param pInputLine Line written by the user
037     * @return The command created
038     */
039    public Command getCommand( final String pInputLine ) 
040    {
041        String vWord1;
042        String vWord2;
043
044        StringTokenizer tokenizer = new StringTokenizer( pInputLine );
045
046        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
047            vWord1 = tokenizer.nextToken();      // get first word
048        else
049            vWord1 = null;
050
051        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() ) {
052            StringBuilder vRest = new StringBuilder( tokenizer.nextToken() );
053            while ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() ) {
054                vRest.append( " " ).append( tokenizer.nextToken() );
055            }
056            vWord2 = vRest.toString();      // capture the full remaining input
057        }
058        else
059            vWord2 = null;
060
061        // note: we just ignore the rest of the input line.
062
063        // Now check whether this word is known. If so, create a command
064        // with it. If not, create a "null" command (for unknown command).
065
066        if ( this.aCommandWords.isCommand( vWord1 ) ) {
067            return new Command( vWord1, vWord2 );
068        } else {
069            return new Command( null, vWord2 );
070        }
071    } // getCommand(.)
072
073    /**
074     * Returns a String with valid command words.
075     * @return A string with valid command words.
076     */
077    public String showCommands(){
078        return this.aCommandWords.getCommandList();
079    } // was showCommands()
080} // Parser
